Comment: I'm guessing that if a prior order raised tariffs on codes for Whiskey, then McConnell can "update" the codes for Whiskey so that the tariffs don't apply to products tagged with the new codes
Author: snowdrone

Comment: This affects products entering the States, not going out. Right now, 2208.30 is the heading for all whiskies, which is then split between two groups, Irish/Scotch whiskies, then bourbon/rye/other. All groups are further divided between containers 4 liters and under, and those over 4 liters. (There is a old HTS temporary code for extra tariffs on UK-sourced Irish/Scotch whiskies that expired in 2021).  This bill may be a nothingburger, or more hilariously, an uninformed non-attempt to protect targeting on bourbon. Change to the HTS does not affect tariffs by other countries, which use their own import coding system.
Author: themaninthehightower
